name: Task
title: Task
publisher: Health Level Seven International (Orders and Observations)

elements.name: Task
elements.description: A task to be performed.

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: The business identifier for this task.

elements.name: instantiatesCanonical
elements.description: The URL pointing to a *FHIR*-defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Task.

elements.name: instantiatesUri
elements.description: The URL pointing to an *externally* maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Task.

elements.name: basedOn
elements.description: BasedOn refers to a higher-level authorization that triggered the creation of the task. It references a "request" resource such as a ServiceRequest, MedicationRequest, ServiceRequest, CarePlan, etc.

elements.name: groupIdentifier
elements.description: An identifier that links together multiple tasks and other requests that were created in the same context.

elements.name: partOf
elements.description: Task that this particular task is part of.

elements.name: status
elements.description: The current status of the task.

elements.name: statusReason
elements.description: An explanation as to why this task is held, failed, was refused, etc.

elements.name: businessStatus
elements.description: Contains business-specific nuances of the business state.

elements.name: intent
elements.description: Indicates the "level" of actionability associated with the Task, i.e. i+R[9]Cs this a proposed task, a planned task, an actionable task, etc.

elements.name: priority
elements.description: Indicates how quickly the Task should be addressed with respect to other requests.

elements.name: code
elements.description: A name or code (or both) briefly describing what the task involves.

elements.name: description
elements.description: A free-text description of what is to be performed.

elements.name: focus
elements.description: The request being actioned or the resource being manipulated by this task.

elements.name: for
elements.description: The entity who benefits from the performance of the service specified in the task (e.g., the patient).

elements.name: encounter
elements.description: The healthcare event (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this task was created.

elements.name: executionPeriod
elements.description: Identifies the time action was first taken against the task (start) and/or the time final action was taken against the task prior to marking it as completed (end).

elements.name: authoredOn
elements.description: The date and time this task was created.

elements.name: lastModified
elements.description: The date and time of last modification to this task.

elements.name: requester
elements.description: The creator of the task.

elements.name: performerType
elements.description: The kind of participant that should perform the task.

elements.name: owner
elements.description: Individual organization or Device currently responsible for task execution.

elements.name: location
elements.description: Principal physical location where the this task is performed.

elements.name: reasonCode
elements.description: A description or code indicating why this task needs to be performed.

elements.name: reasonReference
elements.description: A resource reference indicating why this task needs to be performed.

elements.name: insurance
elements.description: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be relevant to the Task.

elements.name: note
elements.description: Free-text information captured about the task as it progresses.

elements.name: relevantHistory
elements.description: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this Task that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the task.

elements.name: restriction
elements.description: If the Task.focus is a request resource and the task is seeking fulfillment (i.e. is asking for the request to be actioned), this element identifies any limitations on what parts of the referenced request should be actioned.

elements.name: input
elements.description: Additional information that may be needed in the execution of the task.

elements.name: output
elements.description: Outputs produced by the Task.
